abstract.text: A request to modify the attributes of a message.
Siri phrases that trigger the setting of message attributes
A request to modify the attributes of a message.
An interface that handles modifying message attributes.
Your app’s response to a set message attribute intent.
Initializes the set message attribute intent object with the specified identifiers and attribute.
The attribute to apply to the messages.

inlineContent.text: object when the user asks to modify the attributes of one or more messages. Attributes represent information about the message such as whether the user read or flagged the message. This intent object includes the messages to modify and which attributes to change.
To handle this intent, the handler object in your Intents extension must adopt the
protocol. Your handler should confirm the request and create an
object with the results of modifying the messages.
lists additional attributes of this intent object.
Apps can optionally ask the user to unlock the device before handling this intent. To require unlocking of the device, include the name of this class in the
Users can ask Siri to set the attributes of a message in a variety of ways.
provides a few sample phrases in different languages. You can use these phrases during testing to trigger your intents. This list is not exhaustive and Siri may recognize many other phrases.
Read my messages from Bob using
读一下<appName>上李宏辉的信息
Leer los mensajes de Sandra usando
Léeme los mensajes que me mandó Pedro por
Lis mes messages de Jean sur
Lis mes messages écrits par Henri sur
Leggi i miei messaggi da Rosanna su
で太郞からのメッセージを読んで
メッセージを読み上げて
Leia minha mensagem do João no
Leia a última mensagem recebida no
อ่านข้อความจาก
อ่านข้อความของสมชายที่ส่งมาจาก
